title: Quarkus will not live reload when use Vault extension with Gradle
body:
### Describe the bug

When use Vault  (extension `io.quarkus:quarkus-vault`) the projects are not able to restart on the fly (live reload / command `s` on console).

I have tried with: Vault 1.8.4 and Vault 1.12.2.

An exception is thrown:
`java.util.concurrent.RejectedExecutionException: Task io.smallrye.mutiny.infrastructure.MutinyScheduler$DecoratedRunnableTask@7a0339fc rejected from io.quarkus.mutiny.runtime.MutinyInfrastructure$1@41de07f[Terminated, pool size = 0, active threads = 0, queued tasks = 0, completed tasks = 0]`

### Expected behavior

Live reload without problems.

### Actual behavior

An exception is thrown.

### How to Reproduce?

I'm attaching simple project to reproduce:
[proj1.zip](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/files/10221453/proj1.zip)

You should configure vault in project.

But, the basic steps are:
- Create a project and add vault extension;
- Run the running project and try reload.
